sentences.sContent: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
sentences.sCn: 事情发生之后，史密斯声名狼藉。

sentences.sContent: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
There was no disgrace in finishing fourth.
sentences.sCn: 得了个第四名没什么丢脸的。

synos.tran: 耻辱；丢脸的人或事；失宠

words.tran: 耻辱；贬谪（disgrace的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tranOther: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
